events.message: The customer reported an auto accident involving their vehicle on May 1st. They provided initial details about the collision and requested claim initiation.
The claim was categorised under Auto Accident based on the description of a car collision and damage to the vehicle's front bumper.
An agent was assigned to the case to manage communication and facilitate the claims process for the customer's accident.
The insurance company sent an acknowledgment of the claim to the customer, confirming receipt and outlining next steps.
Requested accident report, vehicle photos, and driverâ€™s license copy to support the investigation of the auto accident claim.
Customer submitted all requested documents, including the police report and pictures of the damaged vehicle as evidence.
Investigation began to assess the extent of damage and validate circumstances of the vehicle collision reported by the customer.
Investigation concluded with confirmation of accident details and vehicle repair cost estimates prepared for review.
A settlement offer was proposed to cover property damage and repair costs based on the investigation findings.
The customer expressed satisfaction with the proposed settlement and appreciated the prompt response from the insurance team.
Following customer consent, the claim was formally approved for payment to cover the vehicle repair expenses.
Payment was issued to the repair shop as part of the settlement agreement, facilitating timely vehicle repairs.
The auto accident claim was officially closed after confirmation of repair completion and payment receipt.
All claim documents and correspondence were archived securely for future reference and regulatory compliance.
